newsitem.title: USA: Clark Ill. refinery steps up production.
newsitem.headline: Clark Ill. refinery steps up production.

text.p: Clark Refining and Marketing Co said it stepped up production at its 80,515 barrel per day Blue Island, Ill., refinery after restarting a fluid catalytic cracker idled since a mid-October explosion and fire.
The company said an alkylation unit had not been restarted, but gasoline production was doubled to about two million gallons a day as the fluid catalytic cracker resumed operations.
"That's our normal capacity and we should be just about there," a spokeswoman said.

An Illinois court on November 8 cleared the way for Clark to resume normal production levels after dismissing a lawsuit filed by state regulators seeking to idle the refinery, a key producer in the Chicago market.

Clark had come under fire following an October 19 explosion and fire that idled the alkylation unit and a propane scrubber. The explosion was the third headline-grabbing accident at the plant in the past two years.
Unleaded gasoline basis surged to 8.50 cents a gallon over front-month gasoline futures on the threat the refinery would be shut, and has eased back little since the court decision, traders said.
Clark Refining and Marketing is an operating unit of St. Louis-based Clark USA, itself a subsidiary of Tornoto-based Trizec-Hahn Corp.
